channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: Stretch your summer at Florida’s best spas and wellness escapes
item.description: Labor Day may mark the unofficial end of summer, but in Florida, the heat and the chance for indulgence between hurricanes linger long after the last backyard barbecue. For those not ready to trade flip-flops for fall, the state’s top spas and wellness spaces offer one more excuse to savor summer.

item.title: 'Dancing with the Stars' returns with 2 Floridians: See week 1 scores
item.description: ABC's hit reality dancing show"Dancing with the Stars" returned last nightto celebrate its 20th anniversary and its 34th season, with 14 contestants and their pro partners dancing to their "personal anthem."

item.title: FSU/Asolo Conservatory staging a diverse season of new, classic plays
item.description: A lot has changed in the world and in theater education since Marcus Denard Johnson graduated with his Master of Fine Arts in acting from the FSU/Asolo Conservatory in 2008, but the mission and motivations remain the same as he takes over as director of the three-year graduate acting program.

item.title: Riverview's Toryeon James defies expectations at running back
item.description: Toryeon James may not look the part of a starting high school running back, but he’s been acting like it on Friday nights.

item.title: Venice adds third transfer quarterback as Daniel Pangallo joins Indians
item.description: VENICE — The quarterback competition at Venice High gained another challenger on Monday.

item.title: Selby Gardens moves forward with plan after neighbor's appeal rejected
item.description: Marie Selby Botanical Gardens will continue with phase two of its master plan following the Sarasota City Commission's decision to deny a nearby resident “aggrieved party status” and an appeal after she said phase two would diminish her quality of life.

item.title: What can Florida expect from Tropical Storm Gabrielle…
item.description: Forecasters continue to predictTropical Storm Gabriellewill become the season's second hurricane but on Thursday, Sept. 18, it was struggling.

item.title: Guest dead, found unresponsive after riding Epic…
item.description: Aguest at Epic Universe has diedfollowing a ride onStardust Racerslate Wednesday, according to Universal Orlando and Orange County Fire Rescue Department officials.

item.title: Tropical activity picking up. What's ahead for Florida?
item.description: Activity in the tropics is picking up after a quiet period during what is normally the peak of hurricane season.

item.title: Man dies after riding Florida rollercoaster. What is…
item.description: Avisitor at Epic Universe has diedfollowing aride on Stardust Racerslate Wednesday, according to Universal Orlando and Orange County Fire Rescue Department officials.

item.title: FWC staffer fired over Charlie Kirk Instagram post. What…
item.description: The Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission has fired an employee who reportedly shared an Instagram post joking about Charlie Kirk, the controversial conservative activist who was shot and killed on Sept. 17.

item.title: High School Football Week 5 Sarasota, Manatee game previews and predictions
item.description: Preview capsules and predictions for high school football games being played by Sarasota and Manatee County teams on Thursday, Sept. 18 and Friday, Sept. 19, 2025

item.title: Parrish man injured in second deputy-involved shooting in 2 weeks
item.description: A domestic disturbance call in Parrishended in gunfirelate Sunday after a 29-year-old manpointed a handgun at Manatee County deputies, according to the sheriff’s office.

item.title: Sarasota Schools removes race, gender, disability from code of conduct
item.description: The Sarasota County School Board amended the student code of conduct on Tuesday to remove terms such as race, disability, gender identity, gender expression and sexual orientation.

item.title: Looking for fun things to do this weekend? Top 5 Sarasota events Sept. 18-21
item.description: Summer is almost over, and there’s plenty to get excited about this weekend in Sarasota — fromfootball seasontoOktoberfest, with local bars hosting Bavarian-style beer bashes, including one of my favorites, Calusa Brewing.
